skill.name: quetrex-architect
skill.description: Use when implementing new features in Quetrex. Ensures TDD, TypeScript strict mode, Next.js App Router patterns, ShadCN UI components, and security best practices are followed. Updated for November 2025 standards.
skill.summary: Use when implementing new features in Quetrex. Ensures TDD, TypeScript strict mode, Next.js App Rout...
skill.author: Barnhardt-Enterprises-Inc

security_audit.summary: Prompt-only skill containing only documentation and coding pattern guidance. No executable code, network calls, file writes, or external command execution. Purely informational content for architecture enforcement.

content.value_statement: Inconsistent coding standards lead to technical debt, security vulnerabilities, and difficult maintenance. This skill enforces TDD workflow, TypeScript strict mode, Next.js App Router patterns, and ShadCN UI components for every new feature.
actual_capabilities: Enforces Next.js Server and Client Component patterns
Checks Zod validation on all API routes
Requires TDD workflow with tests written first
Identifies hardcoded secrets and SQL injection risks
limitations: Only provides guidance, does not automatically fix code
Requires CLAUDE.md to exist for full context
Does not execute tests, only describes TDD requirements

use_cases.title: Next.js Component Patterns
use_cases.description: Ensure new React components follow Server Component defaults and Client Component directives.

use_cases.title: API Route Validation
use_cases.description: Validate all API endpoints use Zod schemas for input validation and parameterized queries.

use_cases.title: Test Coverage Enforcement
use_cases.description: Verify code meets coverage thresholds before merge: 75% overall, 90% for services.

prompt_templates.title: New Feature Setup
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new feature with TDD
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me set up a new feature using TDD. Read CLAUDE.md first, then guide me through writing tests before implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Component Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my new component. Check if it correctly uses Server vs Client Components, follows ShadCN patterns, and has proper TypeScript types.

prompt_templates.title: API Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Check my API route. Ensure it has Zod validation for all input, uses parameterized queries, and properly handles errors.

prompt_templates.title: Security Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan my code for hardcoded secrets, SQL injection, XSS vulnerabilities, and missing authentication checks.

output_examples.input: Review my new user profile page
output: - Line 42: Using 'any' type for user data (use explicit UserProfile interface)
- Line 78: Missing Zod validation on POST handler (add schema validation)
- Line 15: Async client component (convert to server or remove async)
See pattern guide for correct implementations.

best_practices: Write failing tests before writing implementation code
Use type guards instead of 'any' for unknown data
Validate all API input with Zod schemas
anti_patterns: Using 'any' type to bypass TypeScript errors
Skipping Zod validation for quick API endpoints
Mixing Server and Client Component responsibilities

faq.question: What tools does this skill work with?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Uses Read, Grep, and Glob tools to analyze code.

faq.question: Does this skill write code automatically?
faq.answer: No. It provides guidance and pattern examples. You must implement fixes yourself following the recommendations.

faq.question: What coverage thresholds are enforced?
faq.answer: 75% overall, 90% for services and utilities, 60% for UI components. Adjust based on project needs.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing workflows?
faq.answer: Call the skill when creating features, reviewing PRs, or refactoring. It reads project context and provides actionable feedback.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads files using standard Claude tools. No code is sent externally or stored anywhere.

faq.question: How is this different from a linter?
faq.answer: Linters catch syntax issues. This skill enforces architectural patterns, workflow practices, and design decisions that linters cannot detect.
